Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The reasoning identifies the expected paths: (1) Receive, Check, Authorize Payment, Package, Ship, Close for sufficient inventory; (2) Receive, Check, Cancel, Close for insufficient inventory. It also captures constraints, such as Authorize before Package and Ship after Package.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Check inventory must determine the path. If sufficient, then proceed to Authorize. If insufficient, then proceed directly to Cancel. This reasoning anchors the expected sequences after Check.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Verifies Case 1 against the normative process. Case 1 follows the 'sufficient inventory' path: Receive, Check, Authorize, Package, Ship, Close. No violations found.

Name: Validation - NE
Text: In Case 2, found that 'Package items' occurs before 'Authorize payment.' This violates the rule that Authorize must precede Package.

Name: Validation - NE
Text: In Case 3, identified two issues: (1) 'Authorize payment' occurs before 'Cancel order,' which is inconsistent with insufficient inventory (Check should directly lead to Cancel). (2) 'Ship order' occurs after 'Cancel order,' which is prohibited.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 4 properly follows the 'insufficient inventory' path: Receive, Check, Cancel, Close. No violations found.

Name: Validation - NE
Text: In Case 5, found that 'Ship order' occurs before 'Package items.' This violates the rule that Package must come after Authorize and before Ship.
